resources.string: Age must be over 18 and weight over 45.
Are you ready for a night of good old controlled fun? What are you waiting for: Press \"Start drinking\".
You need to update you data on profile page before proceeding.
You must be over 18 to use this app.
You should be over 40kg to drink alcohol.
You may have another one, if you wish!
How long will you be drinking?
Start a drinking sessions in the \"Home\" page
An error occurred getting your user profile. Try setting it in the \"Profile\" page.
You have to set your wanted blood level before starting
You can\'t possibly drink that in 0 hours?!
You cannot possibly drink without selecting an alcohol type?
You are already current drinking, aren\'t you? This will reset your current progress. Press \"Yes\" to start a new drinking session.
Enjoy your first drink! I\'ll let you know when it\'s time for more

BAC is a measurement of the alcohol percentage present in 100mL of blood. A BAC of 0.10% indicates that a person has 0.10g per 100mL of blood. BAC is usually measured in percent or permille depening on the country. This app uses permille and 0.1% = 1‰. \n \n https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Blood_alcohol_content

The number of grams of alcohol needed to achieve a certain blood alcohol content (BAC) can be calculated by using ones biological gender and weight. This app uses the Widmark-Forumla as the basis for the computation, solving for the number of units needed based on wanted BAC and estimated time. 

 This gives the following equation:
 Needed Grams = (BAC + 0.015*Hours)*(Weight*GenderConstant) 
 The amount of alcohol in your selected unit will then be used to see how many units will give the closest value, below or equal, to the grams calculated in the formula above. 

 https://www.wikihow.com/Calculate-Blood-Alcohol-Content-(Widmark-Formula)
Can I add my favorite drinks to the app?
Sure! Go to Profile and you can add as many drinks as you want. When selecting the metrics for alcohol, make sure you don’t count the volume of non-alcohol beverages such as soda.
Why does the Blood Alcohol Content bar stop at 0.15%?
Legal reason? Moral reasons? Nah, really, if you want to get drunk I bet you won’t need app for that. This app it to help out those looking for more controlled fun.
When do you want to reach your BAC target?
You will lose your current progress and all alarms will be deleted
What would you like to name your drink?
How strong is your drink in alcohol %?
How large is your drink in liters?
How large is your drink in ounces?
You\'ll need to add a name for your drink
If the drink is without alcohol, I recommend just drinking it normally without this app.
Whao! Over 100%? That\'s too much my friend.
"If you can't win by reason, go for volume. "
"Whops! It seems like you will have to drink nothing based on your selected unit and wanted BAC. "
Are drinks really drinks if they\'re under 2%?
What\'s this volume? A baby shot? Please have your drink larger than 0.02L
What\'s this volume? A baby shot? Please have your drink larger than 1 oz
Whao, take it easy. Drinks over 1L is too much for this app to handle.
Whao, take it easy. Drinks over 33 oz is too much for this app to handle.

Before you start drinking you will have to select the following values: 

 - Wanted blood alcohol content (BAC) 

 - How long you will be drinking 

 - When you want to reach your BAC target 

 - The drink you're planning to drink. 

For instance, say you're planning to drink for 7 hours and reach a BAC of 1‰. You might also want to reach your BAC target before the 7 hours has gone, no problem; just set the time for when you want to reach your BAC taget to e.g. 3 hours. 

Selecting a drink might seem difficult, what if you want to switch between different drinks? Well, honestly, it doesn't matter that much. The calculation made based on the grams of alcohol in your selected drink, so e.g. if you swap a small beer with a glass of wine you probably won't be that of (unless your glass fits a bottle of wine that is). You could find a "standard" unit for your country and select that as your drink for the night. 

Enjoy!
I really like your icons! Did you make them yourself?
"Me too, and I wish I did make them. However, I'm just a developer and I can't do everything. The icons are made by Freepick from www.flaticon.com"

Thank you for installing the app!

You'll need to set your weight and gender in the profile section before we begin, as it is required for the calculation. If you're wondering how it works, check out the information page which can be found in the top right.

DISCLAIMER: The calculations made by this app will never be completely correct. Never use it before driving and other activities which should not be associated with intoxication.
Do you use liter (L) or ounce (oz) for volume?
